Description: A 7.0 magnitude earthquake in Haiti kills 230,000.
2010 Nigerien coup d'état.
2010 Moscow Metro bombings.
The President of Poland, Lech Kaczyński, is among 96 killed when their airplane crashes in Smolensk, Russia.
The largest oil spill in US history occurs in the Gulf of Mexico.
Gaza flotilla raid.
2010 Colombia–Venezuela diplomatic crisis.
North Korea shells the island of Yeonpyeong.
Christchurch earthquake kills 185 and injures 2,000.
A 9.0 earthquake in Japan triggers a tsunami and the meltdown of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant.
Osama bin Laden is shot dead by United States Navy SEALs in Pakistan.
Independence of South Sudan.
2011 Norway attacks.
Riots flare across England.
Muammar Gaddafi is captured and killed during the Battle of Sirte.
revolutions in Tunisia, Egypt and Libya follow, as well as uprisings in Yemen and Bahrain, and protests in several other Arab countries.
Vladimir Putin is elected president of Russia for the third time.
2012 Aurora, Colorado shooting.
2012 Benghazi attack leads to the death of US ambassador J. Christopher Stevens.
Skydiver Felix Baumgartner becomes the first person to break the sound barrier without a vehicle.
Hurricane Sandy causes $70 billion in damage and kills 233 people.
Barack Obama wins second term as President of the United States, defeating former Massachusetts Governor Mitt Romney.
Xi Jinping is elected as General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party.
UN Climate Change Conference agrees to extend the Kyoto Protocol until 2020.
Typhoon Bopha kills over 1,600 in the Philippines.
Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting.
An undiscovered meteor strikes the Chelyabinsk oblast in Russia, with an airburst injuring thousands and damaging many buildings.
Pope Benedict XVI resigns, the first Pope to do since 1415, and Pope Francis is elected, becoming the first Pope from Latin America.
Death and state funeral of Hugo Chavez.
The Rana Plaza collapses in Bangladesh.
British Army soldier Fusilier Lee Rigby of the Royal Regiment of Fusiliers is murdered in Woolwich, southeast London by Islamic terrorists Michael Adebolajo and Michael Adebowale.
Croatia becomes a member of the European Union.
President of Egypt Mohamed Morsi is deposed by the military in a coup d'état.
Birth of Prince George of Wales.
A chemical attack in Ghouta, Syria is blamed on President Bashar al-Assad.
Zamboanga City crisis.
Rockstar Games release Grand Theft Auto V.
A 7.2 magnitude earthquake in Bohol, kills 222.
Typhoon Haiyan kills nearly 6,150 people in Vietnam and the Philippines.
The Euromaidan protest begins in Ukraine.
Death and state funeral of Nelson Mandela.
Euromaidan protest in Ukraine sparks a revolution and the overthrow of Viktor Yanukovych, leading to Russia's annexation of Crimea and the war in Donbas.
Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappears from radar while en route to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur. There were 239 people on board.
The MV Sewol sinks, killing 304 of 476 passengers, 250 of which were students at Danwon High School.
A coup d'état in Thailand overthrows the caretaker government.
King Juan Carlos I of Spain abdicates; his son becomes King Felipe VI.
The shooting of African-American teenager Michael Brown by police leads to violent unrest in Ferguson, Missouri.
The Rosetta spacecraft's Philae probe becomes the first to successfully land on a comet.
Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan kill over 130 students in Pakistan.
Five former Soviet Union countries form the Eurasian Economic Union.
Boko Haram perpetrates a massacre of over 2,000 people in Baga, Nigeria, and allies itself with ISIL.
Al-Shabaab perpetrates a mass shooting in Kenya, killing 148.
The death of an African-American man, Freddie Gray by police leads to violent unrest in Baltimore, Maryland.
Kentex slipper factory fire.
Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action agreement reached, setting limits to Iran's nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief.
Russia begins air strikes against ISIL and anti-government forces in Syria
195 nations agree to lower carbon emissions by negotiating the Paris agreement.
Detection of gravitational waves by LIGO confirmed.
Artificial intelligence program AlphaGo defeats top Go player Lee Sedol in a series of 5 games, winning 4 out of 5 games.
Barack Obama becomes the first U.S. president to visit Cuba since Calvin Coolidge in 1928.
Panama Papers, a leak of legal documents, reveals information of 214,888 offshore companies.
Rodrigo Duterte becomes President of the Philippines, and initiates a controversial drug war.
The Gotthard Base Tunnel, the world's longest and deepest railway tunnel, is completed.
A shooter kills 49 people at a gay nightclub in Orlando, Florida.
The people of the United Kingdom vote to leave the European Union; David Cameron resigns as a result, and Theresa May succeeds him as the second female Prime Minister of the UK.
Juno enters orbit around Jupiter
Mother Teresa is officially canonized by Pope Francis.
The Paris Agreement, signed by 195 nations to fight global warming, formally goes into effect.
Donald Trump wins the 2016 presidential election, in an upset against Hillary Clinton, the first woman to be nominated by a major party.
Donald Trump is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Millions of people participate in the Women's March in response to the inauguration of Donald Trump.
Kim Jong-nam, the half-brother of Kim Jong-Un, is assassinated in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
Pope Francis canonizes Jacinta and Francisco Marto, two of the three Fátima children who reported seeing the Virgin Mary in the spring and summer of 1917.
A terrorist bombing attack at an Ariana Grande concert in Manchester, England kills 22 people and injures over 140.
36 people are killed in an attack in Resorts World Manila.

Charlottesville, Virginia becomes the site of a far-right rally protesting the removal of Confederate statues throughout the US. During the event, a white supremacist rams his car into a crowd of counter-protesters, injuring 19 and killing one.
Two earthquakes strike Mexico on September 8 and September 19, killing over 400 people.
60 people are killed in a mass shooting at a music festival in Las Vegas.
A bombing in Mogadishu, Somalia kills 587 people and injures 316. It is one of the deadliest terrorist attacks in modern history.
'Oumuamua, the first known interstellar object, is identified.
26 people are killed in a church shooting in Sutherland Springs, Texas.
March for Our Lives occurs in 900 locations worldwide in response to the 14 February Parkland shooting.
The first summit between the US and North Korea and the first ever crossing of the Korean Demilitarized Zone by a North Korean leader occur.
Twelve boys and their football coach are successfully rescued from the flooded Tham Luang Nang Non cave in Thailand.
Saudi Arabia allows women to drive.
Exiled Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi is assassinated inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, triggering a diplomatic crisis for Saudi Arabia.
Chang'e 4 becomes the first object to land on the far side of the Moon.
Establishment of the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao.
A series of suicide bombings occur in Sulu, Philippines.
A major fire engulfs Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris, resulting in the roof and main spire collapsing.

Emperor Akihito of Japan abdicates from his throne, the first abdication by a Japanese monarch in almost two centuries. The abdication ends the Heisei era of Japan and ushers in the Reiwa era with new emperor Naruhito ascending the throne on May 1.
India revokes the special status of Jammu and Kashmir.
NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Christina Koch conduct the first all-female spacewalk outside of the ISS.
US President Donald Trump is impeached by the House of Representatives for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.
The United States Space Force is announced by Vice President Mike Pence.
The Royal Australian Air Force and Navy are deployed to New South Wales and Victoria to assist mass evacuation efforts amidst the 2019–20 Australian bushfire season.[1][2]
Qasem Soleimani is targeted and killed at Baghdad International Airport.
Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752 is shot down by Iranian Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) shortly after taking off from Tehran, killing all 176 on board.
Donald Trump is acquitted by the United States Senate in his first impeachment trial.
The United Kingdom formally withdraws from the European Union.
Bong Joon-ho's Parasite becomes the first South Korean film to receive Academy Award recognitions at the 92nd Academy Awards.
The murder of George Floyd sparks protests across the United States and the world.
Crewed spaceflight resumes in the United States for the first time since 2011.
North Korea demolishes the Inter-Korean Liaison Office in Kaesong, established in 2018 to improve relations.
China's National People's Congress grants itself sweeping powers to curtail civil liberties in Hong Kong.
Protests begin in Bulgaria against the government of prime minister Boyko Borisov.
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan orders the Hagia Sophia in Istanbul to be reverted to a mosque following the annulment of a 1934 presidential decree that made it into a museum.
Former Prime Minister of Malaysia Najib Razak is found guilty of all seven charges in the first of five trials on the 1MDB scandal, being jailed 12 years and fined RM210 million as a result.
NASA successfully launches its Mars 2020 rover mission to search for signs of ancient life and collect samples for return to Earth.
An explosion caused by unsafely stored ammonium nitrate kills at least 218 people, injures thousands, and severely damages the port of Beirut, Lebanon.
The Special Tribunal for Lebanon convicts in absentia Salim Ayyash, a senior member of Hezbollah, for the 2005 assassination of former prime Minister Rafic Hariri.
Africa is declared free of wild polio, the second virus to be eradicated from the continent since smallpox 40 years previously.
Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos becomes the first person in history to have a net worth exceeding US$200 billion, according to Forbes.

A United Nations Human Rights Council fact-finding mission formally accuses the Venezuelan government of crimes against humanity, including cases of killings, torture, violence against political opposition and disappearances since 2014.
2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war between Armenia and Azerbaijan.
President of Kyrgyzstan Sooronbay Jeenbekov resigns from office after weeks of massive protests in the wake of the October 2020 parliamentary election.
NASA's OSIRIS-REx spacecraft briefly touches down on 101955 Bennu, becoming the agency's first probe to retrieve samples from an asteroid, with its cargo returning to Earth in 2023.
The Geneva Consensus Declaration on Promoting Women's Health and Strengthening the Family is signed by government representatives from 34 countries.
At the end of an 11-year demining process, the Falkland Islands are declared free of land mines, 38 years after the end of the Falklands War.
The International Organization for Migration (IOM) confirms the death of least 140 migrants who drowned off the coast of Senegal on a vessel bound for the Spanish Canary Islands.

The 2020 United States presidential election occurs. Despite the pandemic, early voting and other factors result in the highest voter turnout since 1900, and a record of over 155 million votes cast. Although Joe Biden is declared the winner on November 7, Donald Trump leads an unprecedented effort to prevent official recognition of his defeat, culminating on January 6 the next year.
The Tigray War begins in Ethiopia.
The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) is signed by 15 Asia-Pacific countries to form the world's largest free-trade bloc, covering a third of the world's population.
The Brereton Report into Australian war crimes during the War in Afghanistan is released.
Iran's top nuclear scientist, Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, is assassinated near Tehran.
Protein folding, one of the biggest mysteries in biology, is solved by AlphaFold, an artificial intelligence algorithm developed by DeepMind.
The Arecibo Telescope of the Arecibo Observatory collapses, just weeks after the announcement of its planned demolition.
The United Nations Commission on Narcotic Drugs votes to remove cannabis from a list of dangerous drugs in recognition of its medical value, although some controls will remain.
Nepal and China officially agree on Mount Everest's actual height, which is 8,848.86m.
Media outlets report that astronomers have detected a radio signal, BLC1, apparently from  the direction of Proxima Centauri, the closest star to the Sun.
A great conjunction of Jupiter and Saturn occurs, with the two planets separated in the sky by 0.1 degrees. This is the closest conjunction between the two planets since 1623.
The African Continental Free Trade Area comes into effect.
Supporters of President Donald Trump, gathered after a rally led by him, attack the United States Capitol, leading to five deaths.
Kim Jong-un is elected as the General Secretary of the ruling Workers' Party of Korea, inheriting the title from his father Kim Jong-il, who died in 2011.
In Lyon, France, the first transplant of both arms and shoulders is performed on an Icelandic patient at the Édouard Herriot Hospital.
Donald Trump is impeached for a second time following the events of January 6, but is acquitted again after his trial from February 9–13.
Joe Biden is inaugurated as President of the United States. Kamala Harris, sworn in as vice president, becomes the first woman, first African American and first Asian American to be vice president.
The Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons, the first legally binding international agreement comprehensively to prohibit nuclear weapons, comes into effect.
Winter Storm Uri becomes the costliest winter storm in North American history, costing $200 billion and 237 lives, and triggering the 2021 Texas power crisis.
NASA's Mars 2020 mission (containing the Perseverance rover and Ingenuity helicopter drone) lands on Mars at Jezero Crater, after seven months of travel.
Luca Attanasio, the Italian ambassador to the Democratic Republic of the Congo, is murdered near Goma.
Pope Francis meets with Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani in Najaf, Iraq. It is the first-ever meeting between a pope and a grand ayatollah.
The Spanish Congress of Deputies passes the euthanasia law.[3]
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan announces his country's withdrawal from the Istanbul Convention, the first country to do so.
Clashes in Apure between Colombian FARC dissidents and the Venezuelan Armed Forces cause at least six casualties and displace 4,000 Venezuelans.
The container ship Ever Given obstructs the Suez Canal for six days, costing an estimated $3.6 billion in global trade.
Buckingham Palace announces the death of Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh and husband of the Queen, at the age of 99.
Hideki Matsuyama wins the 2021 Masters Tournament, becoming the first man from Japan to win a major golf championship.

Japan's government approves the dumping of radioactive water of the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant into the Pacific Ocean over the course of 30 years, with full support of the International Atomic Energy Agency.
Scientists announce they successfully injected human stem cells into the embryos of monkeys, creating chimera-embryos.
Idriss Déby, President of Chad, is killed in clashes with rebel forces after 30 years in office.
Following an international search and rescue effort, the Indonesian navy reports the sinking of KRI Nanggala with 53 crew members, the largest loss of life aboard a submarine since 2003.
A border clash between Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan leads to 55 deaths.
Hundreds die in conflicts after Israel evicts six Palestinian families from East Jerusalem.
Ryanair Flight 4978 is forced to land by Belarusian authorities to detain dissident journalist Roman Protasevich.
The Juno spacecraft performs its only flyby of Jupiter's moon Ganymede, the first flyby of the moon by any spacecraft in over 20 years.

Benjamin Netanyahu, the longest-serving prime minister of Israel, is voted out of office; Naftali Bennett and Yair Lapid are sworn in as Prime Minister of Israel and as Alternate Prime Minister of Israel, respectively.
Joe Biden signs Juneteenth National Independence Day Act into law, making Juneteenth a federal holiday. It is the first new federal holiday since Martin Luther King Jr. Day.[4][5]
The Champlain Towers South condominium in Surfside, Florida, collapses, killing 98 people.
50 people are killed and 46 others are injured when a C-130 transport plane of the Philippine Air Force crashes in Jolo, Sulu.
Haitian President Jovenel Moïse, is assassinated in a midnight attack by unknown mercenaries.

An international investigation reveals that spyware sold by Israel's NSO Group to different governments is being used to target heads of state, along with thousands of activists, journalists and dissidents around the world.
Blue Origin successfully conducts its first human test flight, with a reusable New Shepard rocket delivering four crew members into space including its founder Jeff Bezos.
The first direct observation of light from behind a black hole is reported, confirming Einstein's theory of general relativity.

The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change releases the first part of its Sixth Assessment Report, which concludes that the effects of human-caused climate change are now "widespread, rapid, and intensifying".
An earthquake in Haiti kills over 2,000 people.

Kabul falls following the 2021 Taliban offensive, as the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan collapses, and the country is governed thereafter by the Taliban as the reinstated Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. The War in Afghanistan thus ends after 20 years following the withdrawal of U.S. and coalition troops.
The UN Environment Programme announces that leaded petrol in road vehicles has been phased out globally, a hundred years after its introduction.
El Salvador becomes the first country in the world to accept Bitcoin as an official currency.
North Korea demonstrates two short-range ballistic missiles that land just outside Japan's territorial waters; hours later South Korea demonstrates its first submarine-launched ballistic missile.

A trilateral security pact between Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States is formed to counter Chinese influence. This includes enabling Australia to build its first nuclear-powered submarine fleet.
Inspiration4, launched by SpaceX, becomes the first all-civilian spaceflight, carrying a four-person crew on a three-day orbit of the Earth.

The International Consortium of Investigative Journalists and assorted media partners publish a set of 11.9 million documents leaked from 14 financial services companies known as the Pandora Papers, revealing offshore financial activities that involve multiple current and former world leaders.
The World Health Organization endorses the first malaria vaccine.
Russia draws international condemnation following an anti-satellite weapon test that creates a cloud of space debris, threatening the International Space Station.
Barbados becomes a republic on its 55th anniversary of independence while remaining a member of the Commonwealth of Nations.
A truck crash in Chiapas, Mexico, kills 55 migrants who were being smuggled in it from Guatemala through Mexico to its border with the United States.
Typhoon Rai lashes into Visayas and Mindanao, killing 409 people.
Coups d'état in Burkina Faso.
2022 Kazakh unrest.

China, France, Russia, the UK, and the US—all five permanent members of the United Nations Security Council—issue a rare joint statement affirming that "a nuclear war cannot be won and must never be fought."[6]
The Hunga Tonga–Hunga Haʻapai eruption and tsunami is the largest and most powerful volcanic eruption in decades, and the largest explosion ever recorded by modern instruments.
The 2022 Winter Olympics are held in Beijing, China, making it the first city ever to host both the Summer Olympics and Winter Olympics.[7]
Russia invades Ukraine, escalating the Russo-Ukrainian War, causing a refugee crisis and tens of thousands of deaths on both sides.
WHL0137-LS "Earendel" imaged by Hubble Space Telescope, the earliest and most distant known star.
Sri Lankan protests.
Pakistani constitutional crisis and attempted assassination of Imran Khan.
Elon Musk purchases Twitter.
Kane Tanaka, the second oldest verified person to have ever lived, dies at the age of 119.
Monkeypox outbreak.
Sagittarius A*, supermassive black hole at Galactic Center, imaged by Event Horizon Telescope.
Heat waves in Europe kill tens of thousands.
Earthquake in Afghanistan.
Ketanji Brown Jackson becomes the first black woman on the Supreme Court.
United Kingdom government crises
Oder environmental disaster.
Assassination of Shinzo Abe.
James Webb Space Telescope takes Webb's First Deep Field, oldest and highest resolution image of the universe to date.
Chinese paddlefish declared extinct.
China conducts its largest ever military exercise around Taiwan in response to a controversial visit by Nancy Pelosi.
"Man of the Hole", reclusive indigenous Brazilian and last of his ethnicity, dies.
Floods in Pakistan trigger an economic crisis.
UN Human Rights Office report on Xinjiang is released.
Elizabeth II dies at the age of 96, and is succeeded by Charles III.
Mahsa Amini protests.
Eliud Kipchoge sets marathon world record at the 2022 Berlin Marathon.
Double Asteroid Redirection Test demonstrates capabilities on asteroid (65803) Didymos I Dimorphos.
Hurricane Ian impacts Cuba and the US, causing catastrophic damage to both nations, killing at least 157 people, 16 missing, and leaving millions without power, including the entirety of Cuba.
A fatal human crush occurs during an association football match at Kanjuruhan Stadium in Malang Regency, East Java, Indonesia, killing 131 people and injuring more than 500.
36 people are killed in a shooting, stabbing, and vehicle-ramming at Nong Bua Lamphu, Thailand.
Ethiopia–Tigray peace agreement.
The FTX cryptocurrency exchange files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.
The world population is estimated to have reached 8 billion.
NASA launches Artemis 1, the first uncrewed mission of its Space Launch System, the most powerful rocket ever to reach orbit.
COVID-19 protests in China.
OpenAI launches ChatGPT, an AI chatbot.
Self-coup attempt, impeachment and arrest of President Pedro Castillo sparks protests in Peru.
Qatar corruption scandal at the European Parliament.
2023 Israeli judicial reform protests.
2023 Brazilian Congress attack.
2023 French pension reform strikes.
2023 Turkey-Syria earthquakes kill nearly 60,000 people.
Cyclone Freddy kills 1,400 in Malawi and Mozambique.
Iran and Saudi Arabia restore diplomatic relations.
Finland joins NATO.
R21/Matrix-M malaria vaccine approved for use.
War in Sudan.
SpaceX conducts the first full stack test launch of the world's most powerful rocket, Starship.
World Health Organization ends the designation of COVID-19 as a public health emergency of international concern.
Charles III is crowned king of the United Kingdom and Commonwealth realms.
2023 Ecuadorian political crisis.
2023 Odisha train collision.
Kwara boat disaster.
2023 SAG-AFTRA strike.
2023 Nigerien coup d'état.
ISRO's Chandrayaan 3 lands on the lunar south pole making India the 4th nation to successfully soft land on the Moon.
2023 Gabonese coup d'état.
2023 Marrakesh-Safi earthquake kills nearly 6000 people.
Storm Daniel becomes the deadiest Mediterranean storm in history, with over 4000 deaths in Libya.
2023 Azerbaijani offensive in Nagorno-Karabakh.
Kevin McCarthy's expulsion via a motion introduced by Matt Gaetz is the first ousting of a Speaker of the United States House of Representatives in history.
Hamas attacks Israel; start of the Israel-Hamas war.
2023 Herat earthquakes.
2023 Guayana Esequiba crisis.
Operation 1027, a coordinated assault by anti-Junta forces in the Myanmar civil war, begins.
Somalia admitted to East African Community.
COP28 ends with world leaders pledging transition away from fossil fuels.
Catholic Church releases Fiducia supplicans.
Queen Margrethe II of Denmark announces her abdication on January 14 after 52 years on the throne.
